intro: Odontarrhena castellana, commonly known as the Castilian orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in early spring and are pollinated by insects. Odontarrhena castellana is a rare and protected species, reflecting its ecological significance in Mediterranean ecosystems.
